intro: Polycarpaea atherophora, commonly known as the pale-flowered milkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have a pale or white color. Polycarpaea atherophora is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats.
